Gravitational wave detectors can detect: Can gravitational wave detectors detect waves from merging black holes? Gravitational wave detection merging black holes
When a pair of black holes within an active galactic nucleus disk merges, the collision produces gravitational waves that can be picked up by detectors on Earth.
Can gravitational wave detectors detect waves from merging black holes? Gravitational wave detection merging black holes

Physicists have concluded that the detected gravitational waves were produced during the final fraction of a second of the merger of two black holes to produce a single, more massive spinning black hole. This collision of two black holes had been predicted but never observed.

detail.reasoning: The given text states that gravitational wave detectors can detect waves from merging black holes. The provided evidences support this claim.
